pullRequest.body:
Follow-up to #10816.

Remaining places containing such lemmas are
- `Option.bex_ne_none` and `Option.ball_ne_none`: defined in Lean core
- `Nat.decidableBallLT` and `Nat.decidableBallLE`: defined in Lean core
- `bef_def` is still used in a number of places and could be renamed
- `BAll.imp_{left,right}`, `BEx.imp_{left,right}`, `BEx.intro` and `BEx.elim`

I only audited the first ~150 lemmas mentioning "ball"; too many lemmas named after Metric.ball/openBall/closedBall.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Thank you for the quick review. I have addressed all comments.
Updated again.

Thanks!
bors d=@YaelDillies

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> in Logic.Basic: this has lemmas like `forall_of_ball` and conversely, so it's not obvious how to name them

Can you simply replace `ball` by `forall_mem` in those names?

I went over all lemmas in Logic.Basic, replacing "bex" by "exists_mem" and "ball" by "forall_mem". Oof.

There are a couple of occurrences of "bef_def"; be my guest to remove them :-)

Do you have an opinion about `{BAll,BEx}.imp_{left,right}` in `Logic.Basic`?
I could rename them to Forall/Exists.imp_{left,right} instead.

> Do you have an opinion about `{BAll,BEx}.imp_{left,right}` in `Logic.Basic`? I could rename them to Forall/Exists.imp_{left,right} instead.

There are also BEx.intro and BEx.elim remaining.
Thanks for the careful comments again; I have addressed them.
Feel free to do any of the remaining three lemmas yourself, if it's faster this way.
Must be gone for the night, but I will if you haven't done them in the next 8-9 hours.

@YaelDillies I just rebased this and fixed the one easy lemma. Do you have energy left to fix the two remaining lemmas?

In any case: thanks for all your help on this PR!

Now done. LGTM

Could you simply delete this lemma in favour of `Set.mem_image`?
```suggestion
@[deprecated mem_image] -- 2024-03-23
theorem mem_image_iff_bex {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : Set Î±} {y : Î²} :
    y âˆˆ f '' s â†” âˆƒ (x : _) (_ : x âˆˆ s), f x = y :=
  bex_def.symm
```

```suggestion
instance decidableExistsMem : âˆ€ (l : List Î±), Decidable (âˆƒ x âˆˆ l, p x)
```

```suggestion
instance decidableForallMem (l : List Î±) : Decidable (âˆ€ x âˆˆ l, p x) :=
```
I don't think we should be deprecating instance names.
Makes sense! Dropped.

```suggestion
theorem not_exists_mem_nil (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : Â¬âˆƒ x âˆˆ @nil Î±, p x :=
```
This one already exists...
AFAICT, it is not used in mathlib, though.

```suggestion
theorem exists_mem_cons (p : Î± â†’ Prop) (a : Î±) (l : List Î±) :
```
This one already existed, i.e. this lemmas was a duplicate. Changed the align and alias accordingly and deleted this lemma.

```suggestion
-- 2024-03-23
@[deprecated] alias List.not_bex_nil := List.not_exists_mem_nil
@[deprecated] alias List.bex_cons := List.exists_mem_cons
```
I'm not convinced this is really better, but I don't feel strongly. Changed.

```suggestion
theorem forall_mem_empty {p : Î± â†’ Prop} : (âˆ€ x âˆˆ (âˆ… : Set Î±), p x) â†” True :=
```

```suggestion
@[deprecated] alias ball_empty_iff := forall_empty_iff -- 2024-03-23
```
and below, else you're creating `Set.Set.ball_empty_iff`

```suggestion
theorem Nonempty.exists_mem {s : Finset Î±} (h : s.Nonempty) : âˆƒ x : Î±, x âˆˆ s :=
```

```suggestion
theorem not_exists_mem_nil (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : Â¬âˆƒ x âˆˆ @nil Î±, p x :=
```
This lemma already exists (line 75 of that file): as-is, this change doesn't compile
Can you deduplicate then?
AFAICT, this theorem is never used in mathlib: I've removed it (and kept the align, as it points to the other lemma).

```suggestion
theorem exists_mem_insert {P : Î± â†’ Prop} {a : Î±} {s : Set Î±} :
```

```suggestion
theorem mem_map {f : G â†’* N} {K : Subgroup G} {y : N} : y âˆˆ K.map f â†” âˆƒ x âˆˆ K, f x = y := Iff.rfl
```

```suggestion
theorem mem_map {f : F} {S : Submonoid M} {y : N} : y âˆˆ S.map f â†” âˆƒ x âˆˆ S, f x = y := Iff.rfl
```
so that it can be used by `dsimp`

```suggestion
theorem mem_map {f : F} {s : NonUnitalSubsemiring R} {y : S} : y âˆˆ s.map f â†” âˆƒ x âˆˆ s, f x = y := Iff.rfl
```
so that it can be used by `dsimp`

```suggestion
      rcases hI with âŸ¨i, hiâŸ©
```

```suggestion
theorem existsâ‚‚_imp : (âˆƒ x h, P x h) â†’ b â†” âˆ€ x h, P x h â†’ b := by simp
```
Actually this is a stupid lemma. Can you revert the rename and deprecate it to `id`?
Can you revert the rename and deprecate to `forall_imp`?

```suggestion
theorem not_forallâ‚‚_of_existsâ‚‚_not : (âˆƒ x h, Â¬P x h) â†’ Â¬âˆ€ x h, P x h
```

```suggestion

#align not_ball not_forallâ‚‚
```

```suggestion
theorem forallâ‚‚_true_iff (p : Î± â†’ Sort*) : (âˆ€ x, p x â†’ True) â†” True :=
```

As this lemma already existed, I deduplicated this one instead.

```suggestion
theorem forallâ‚‚_or_left : (âˆ€ x, p x âˆ¨ q x â†’ r x) â†” (âˆ€ x, p x â†’ r x) âˆ§ âˆ€ x, q x â†’ r x :=
```
etc
Done: should `forall_mem_congr` be left as-is? Or perhaps, my real question is: what do we use "forallâ‚‚" for?
`âˆ€ x âˆˆ s,` is `forall_mem`. `âˆ€ x y,` is `forallâ‚‚`
:bulb: Thank you, now it makes sense!

```suggestion
theorem forallâ‚‚_congr (H : âˆ€ x h, P x h â†” Q x h) : (âˆ€ x h, P x h) â†” âˆ€ x h, Q x h :=
```

This already exists, with a different signature: https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/PropLemmas.html#forall%E2%82%82_congr
Replacing them wasn't obvious to me at this hour.
Done

```suggestion
theorem existsâ‚‚_congr (H : âˆ€ x h, P x h â†” Q x h) : (âˆƒ x h, P x h) â†” âˆƒ x h, Q x h :=
```

This already exists, with a different signature: https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/PropLemmas.html#exists%E2%82%82_congr
Replacing them wasn't obvious to me at this hour.
I know ðŸ˜‰ The lemma here is a special case of the existing `existsâ‚‚_congr`

```suggestion
theorem exists_eq_left {a : Î±} : (âˆƒ (x : _) (_ : x = a), p x) â†” p a := by
```
Same here, this already exists at: https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/PropLemmas.html#exists_eq_left
This one I think you can just deprecate since it's quite convoluted and simplifiable by simp already

```suggestion

```
